title: Corporate Governance Practices of Mobilicom Ltd

content.text: Mobilicom Ltd has a board of directors composed of six members. The board includes both executive and non-executive directors. The executive directors are responsible for the day-to-day operations of the company, while the non-executive directors provide independent oversight and guidance. This composition helps to ensure a balance of expertise and perspectives in the decision-making process.

Mobilicom Ltd follows a structured approach to executive compensation. The company's executive compensation policy is designed to align the interests of executives with those of shareholders and promote long-term value creation. The compensation package includes a mix of fixed salary, variable performance-based incentives, and equity-based rewards. This helps to incentivize executives to achieve strategic objectives and drives performance.

The board composition of Mobilicom Ltd reflects a good balance between executive and non-executive directors, ensuring a diversity of perspectives and independent oversight. This promotes robust decision-making and reduces the risk of conflicts of interest. The company's executive compensation policy is also well-structured, aligning executive interests with long-term shareholder value creation. This encourages executives to drive performance and achievement of company goals.
